verses.verse: Why do You stand far away, O Jehovah? Will You hide in times of distress?
The wicked one in his pride will pursue the afflicted one; they will be caught in the schemes which they have devised.
For the wicked one boasts of his soul's desire, and he has blessed the covetous; scorning Jehovah.
Through pride of his face, the wicked one will not seek; there is no God in all of his schemes.
His ways are perverted at all times. Your judgments are high from his sight; as for all distressing him, he puffs at them.
He has said in his heart, I shall not be moved! From generation to generation never in evil.
His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and oppression; under his tongue are mischief and vanity.
He dwells in the dens of the villages; in the secret places he murders the innocent one; his eyes watch against the poor one.
He lies in wait secretly like a lion in his den; he lies in ambush to catch the poor one; he seizes the humble ones drawing him into his net;
and being crushed, he bows; yea, the poor ones have fallen by his mighty ones.
He has said in his heart, God has forgotten; He hides His face; He will not see forever.
Arise, O Jehovah! O God, lift up your hand; do not forget the lowly ones.
Upon what does the wicked one despise God? He has said in his heart, You will not demand it.
You have seen, for You take note of mischief and provocation, to give back with Your hand. The poor one leaves himself to You; You are the helper of the orphan.
Break the arm of the wicked and evil one; search out his wickedness until You find none.
Jehovah is King forever and ever; the nations are perished out of His land.
O Jehovah, You have heard the desire of the humble one; You will fix their heart; Your ear will hear.
Judge the orphan and the crushed one No more shall the man of the earth continue to terrify.
